title: Vertex AI - Apply model labels
abstract:
# Vertex AI - Apply model labels
From the Vertex AI Model Registry landing page, you can see all your models and default model versions in a single view. Adding labels can help you identify and organize your models by light-weight key identifiers. You can add labels at the model-level and also at the version-level.
Use the following instructions to add a label to a model.- In the Google Cloud console, go to the **Model Registry** page. [Go to Model Registry](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/models) 
- From the Vertex AI Model Registry, locate the name of the model you want   to label. Select the **More actions** menumore_vertfor the specific model.
- From the drop-down, select **Edit labels** .
- Click the **Add label** action button and add your key and value. For example,  the key can represent a value like **created_by** and the value can be **datascientist1** .
- Click **Save** .
Add a label to a model version- In the Google Cloud console, go to the **Model Registry** page. [Go to Model Registry](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/models) 
- From the Vertex AI Model Registry, select the name of the model which has the version you want  to label. The model details page opens.
- Select the **More actions** menumore_vertfor the specific model version you want to label.
- Click **Edit labels** . Enter the name of the new label you want to apply to the model version.
- Click **Save**
